Bose & Kar 1966 Subturma MONOCOLPATES Iverson & Troels-Smith 1950 Cycadopites glaber (Luber & Waltz) Hart 1965 Subturma PRAECOLPATES Potonié & Kremp 1954 Infraturma PRAECOLPATI Potonié & Kremp 1954 Marsupipollenites striatus (Balme & Henneíly) Hart 1965 Marsupipollenites triradiatus Balme & Henneíly 1956 Alisporítes australis De Jersey 1962 Diagnosis Grains disaccate, total span (based on 64 measured specimens) 60/2m -11O^m. Corpus longer than wide (polar view), ratio lenght to width greater than 5 - 4. Lenght of corpus 38Mm - 76^m. Colpus (observed in well preserved, suitably oriented specimens) extending full length of corpus. Sacei not or scarcely overtapping on to proximal surface, roots of sacei markedly offset distally. Sacei as deep as corpus, or a little less. Ornament on sacei: brochi about 3^m in diameter, muri about 1 micron wide. Ornament on corpus indistict to faintly reticulate. Corpus and sacei without marked thickening, light yellow to brownish yellow thickness about l^m - 1.5^m. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal do corpo central: 38/j.m - 78mITI. Diâmetro total: 60^m - HO^m. Observação Esta espécie distingue-se das demais descritas para o gênero pela presença de um sulco. Foster (1979) registrou formas de A. australis no Permiano da Austrália, Bacia de Sydney. Holótipo Locus typicus: Poço N.S. 176 (Jazida de carvão de Ipswich, 501 ft.) 1/2 pol a 507 pés, Austrália. Stratum typicum: veio Bluff, Triássico. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 3-MC-3-SC (Matos Costa, Santa Catarina), T-10 (1 710,50m), Bacia do Paraná. Repositório: PETROBRAS/CENPES: lâmina paiinológica (LP. 9304441), EF. Z 58-3. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano (Asseliano ao Tatariano). Afinidade Botânica GYMNOSPERMAE (Glossopteridophyta ou Pteridospermophyta). Alisporites splendens (Leschik) Foster 1979 1956:Sulcatisporites splendens Leschik Diagnosis Disaccate, haploxylonoid. Amb oval to near rectangular. Corpus elongate oval, with length exceeding breadth. Definition of corpus fairly clear in terminal areas, and becoming less so laterally. Cappa less than l^m thick and intramicroreticulate. Sacei semicircular in outline, somewhat distally inclined, and sometimes slightly continuous laterally. Sacei exoexine less than 1Mm thick, and intrareticulate with brochi about 1^m in diameter. Brochi not radially elongate near sacei bases. Cappula breadth 1/4 that of corpus, or less, with sacei occcasionally overlapping in area of cappula. Cappula either parallel-sided or widening at lateral extremities. Exine of cappula thin and lacking strueture or sculpture. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 41^m - 90^m. Eixo transversal do corpo: 31 - 65Mm Eixo longitudinal do corpo: IS^m - 40^m. Observação De acordo com Foster (1979), dentre as associações por ele estudadas, é difícil distinguir A. splendens de A, plicatus Jizba (1962), pois cada uma é vista como membro de uma íntergradação morfológica. Holótipo Locus typicus: Salzton von Neuhof (Bei Fulda) Alemanha. Stratum typicum: Zechstein (Permiano Superior). Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 3-MC-3-SC (Matos Costa, Santa Catarina), T-8 ( 1 651,90m), Bacia do Paraná. Repositório: PETROBRAS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP. 9304439), EF. Q 36-2/P 36-4. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano (Asseíiano ao Kunguriano). Afinidade Botânica GYMNOSPERMAE, Glossopteridophyta (?). Anapiculatisporites subbaculiferus Nahuys, Alpern & Ybert 1968 Diagnosis Spores trilete, amb triangular with rounded ápices and convex or concave sides. Laesura extending about 3/4 radius and sometimes straight or slightly sinuous. Exine thin, light yellow. Contact areas smooth; but in distai view sculptured by elements about 0.5^m - 3.5^m in basal diameter. Bacula packed close the contact areas where they form a distinct row. Dimensões Diâmetro: 35^m (45) 55^m. Observação A espécie é caracterizada pelo arranjo dos ornamentos na face distai. Holótipo Locus typicus-, Mina de Charqueadas, camada l2B n° 1 - 224m, Rio Grande do Sul. Brasil. Stratum typicum: Formação Rio Bonito. Permiano. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 3-MC-3-SC (Matos Costa, Santa Catarina), T-4 (1 628,80m), Bacia do Paraná Repositório: PETROBRAS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP. 9304436), EF. V 52-3. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano (Sakmariano ao Kunguriano). Afinidade Botânica Desconhecida. Apiculatisporis cornutus (Balme & Hennelly) Segroves 1970 1956: Apiculatísporites cornutus Balme & Hennelly Diagnosis Amb circular to sub-circular. Trilete; laesurae usually indistinct, laesura arms sínuous and extending to, or almost to , equator. Lips sometimes, slightly developed. Exjne 1/jm - 3^171 thick, sometimes punctate, and bearing processes 1^m - 3^m in basal diameter, 1,5^m - 4^m high, and 0.5^m - 6^m apart Ápices of processes often setose. Dimensões Diâmetro: 29^171 (37) 45^m. Observação Difere das outras espécies pela forma em seta de seus ornamentos Holótipo Locus typicus: Mina Cessnock n° 1, Nova Gales do Sul, Austrália. Stratum typicum: veio Main Greta, campo de carvão Greta Coal, Permiano. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 3-MC-3-SC (Matos Costa, Santa Catarina), T-10 (1 719,80m), Bacia do Paraná. Repositório: PETROBRAS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP. 9304443), EF. F-58/1. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano (Sakmariano/Artinskiano). Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Sphenophyta, Filicophyta). Apiculatisporis paranaensis sp. nov. 1968: Apiculatisporis irregularis Nahuys, Alpern & Ybert (non A. irregularis Smith & Butterworth 1967, p. 171) Diagnosis Spores trilete, amb subtriangular to subcircuiar. Laesura sometimes obscured by sculpture. Laesura extending to the margin of the spore. Exine thin sculptured by flatenned coni commonly visible on margin. The coni are sparsed and have 1^m - 2/.m in lenght and 5^m - 6^m in basal diameter. On proximal view there are some spinae or bacula with 1^m - 3^m in basal diameter and 6^m - 7Mm in lenght, recurved over the spore. Dimensões Diâmetro: 20^m - 50 ^m. Observação A espécie A. irregularis é um homônimo-júnior de uma espécie distinta anteriormente descrita por Smith & Butterworth 1967 (p. 171). Holótipo Locus typicus: Mina de Charqueadas, camada l2B, n° 1 - 224m, Rio Grande do Sul, Brasil. Stratum typicum: Formação Rio Bonito, Permiano. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 2-AO-1-RS (Atanásio, Rio Grande do Sul), carvão 6 (2 096,20m), Bacia do Paraná. Repositório: lâmina palinológica (LP. 4488), EF. E 35-2. A lâmina com o tipo foi arquivada no DNPM (Departamento Nacional da Produção Minerai) sob o número MCT-Palinologia 54. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano (Sakmariano ao Ufimiano). Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Filicophyta). Caheniasaccites ovatus (Bose & Kar) emend. Archangelsky & Gamerro 1979 1966: Caheniasaccites ovatus Bose & Kar Diagnosis Pollen monosaccate in polar view with the saccus strongly.constricted in the middle, apparently bisaccate in appearance. Central body subcircular to oval, thick, dark, commonly with secondary folds; monolete mark in proximal view extending 1/2 to 1/3 of central body. Ectexine of central body intramicroreticulate in both sides. Saccus attachment subequatorial strongly frilled and commonly constricted iaterally and widely spread in the endings, giving a bisaccate appearance. Distai roots radially folded overtapping about 1/5 of diameter enclosing a distai leptome with the general shape ofthe centrai body; proximaí rootill-defmed. Saccus intrareticulation with small lumina, dense and radially arranged. Dimensões Diâmetro do corpo central: 27^m (56) 65^m. Eixo longitudinal: 68^m (98) 160^m. Eixo transversal: 42^m (57) 93^171. Observação Archangelsky & Gamerro (1979) observaram tratar-se de gênero muito parecido com Potonieisporites, do qual se diferencia apenas pelas dobras na porção lateral do saco e pelo aspecto constricto do mesmo, que ihe confere a aparência bissacada. A emenda resultou da observação por parte desses autores. A espécie tem sido registrada amplamente na Bacia do Paraná, bem como no Carbonifero e Permiano do Uruguai e Argentina. Holótipo Locus typicus: Rodovia Kindu-Kalima (km 28,3-1) Congo, África. Stratum typicum: Barakar Inferior da índia, Permiano. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 3-MC-3-SC (Matos Costa, Santa Catarina) T-14 (1 764,60m), Bacia do Paraná. Repositório: PETROBRÁS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP. 9304447) , EF. G-42. Distribuição Estratigráfica Carbonifero Superior (Westfaliano) ao Permiano Superior (Asseliano ao Kazaniano). Afinidade Botânica GYMNOSPERMAE (Coniferophyta). CATÁLOGO DE ESPOROS E PÓLEN FÓSSEIS DO PALEOZÓICO B. Geoci. PETROBRAS. Rio de Janeiro, 9 (1): 1-151, jan./mar. 1995 Calamospora liquida Kosanke 1950 Diagnosis Spores are radiai, trilete, spherical and have numerous plications ofthe spore coat. The holotype measures 81.6^m x 84aí!ti, and the known size range is from 76Mm - 94 . The plications are numerous and somewhat parallel to the outline of the spore. The trilete rays of the holotype are distinct and vary in lenghtfrom 26.2^m - 31.5 ^m. The lips are moderately developed and definetely elevated. The commissure is usually thin but distinct. The area contagionis is not present. The spore coat is íevigate and translucent. it is less than 2Mm in thickness which probabiy accounts for the numerous plications. Dimensões Diâmetro total: 75/zm - 95 ^m. Observação Calamospora liquida Kosanke 1950 difere das outras espécies do gênero Calamospora por apresentar diâmetro maior. Holótipo Locus typicus: Camada de carvão Shoal Greek, Bond, lllinois, U.S.A. Stratum typicunr Pensilvaniano. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 2-UV-1-PR (União da Vitória, Paraná), T-54 (1 062,15m), Bacia do Paraná Repositório: PETROBRÁS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP. 9303528). EF. S-37-1/36-2. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano (Sakmariano ao Kunguriano). Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Sphenophyta). Calamospora minuta Bharadwaj 1957 Diagnosis Pale yellow. circular spores, trilete mark distinct, apex and vertex elevated. tecta flexuose, labra thin, tecta ends not bifurcated. Intertectum exine slightly darkened and appears to be the area contagionis. Exine laevigate, translucent and appears dense, thickness not measurable but due to the characteristic crescentic secondary folds it is presumably of médium thickness for its size. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 34^m - 46_um. Observação C. minuta difere de C. saariana Bharadwaj 1957 pelos raios da marca trilete apresentarem maior dimensão. Holótipo Locus typicus'. horizonte Leaia, Mina Gõttelborn, Saar, Alemanha. Stratum typicum: Westfaíiano C - Estefaniano (Carbonifero Superior). Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 3-MC-3-SC (Matos Costa, Santa Catarina), T-8 (1 651,90m), Bacia do Paraná. Repositório: PETROBRAS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP. 9304439). EF. T-27. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano Superior (Ufimiano). Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Sphenophyta). Calamospora plicata (Luber & Waltz) Hart 1965 1941: Azonotriletes plicatus Luber & Waltz Diagnosis Spores roundly triangular to circular in outline, usually obscured by large-scale folding that gives an irregularly polygonal outline. Trilete sutures extending one-half to two-thirds radius. Dimensões Diâmetro total: 45^m - 60^m. Observação Calamospora plicata difere de C. inderjensis pelo seu tamanho maior e de C. sinuosa pelo comprimento das laesurae. Holótipo Locus typicus'. Bacia de Pechora, localidade Intorsk, U.S.S.R. Stratum typicum: Permiano. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 2-AO-1-RS (Atanásio, Rio Grande do Sul), carvão 7 ( 2 096,10m), Bacia do Paraná. Repositório: PETROBRÁS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP. 4489), EF. P-53-4. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano (Sakmariano ao Ufimiano). Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Sphenophyta). Calamospora saaríana Bharadwaj 1957
Diagnosis Pale yellow circular spores, triíete mark distinct but not proeminent, apex and vertex low, sutures mostly open, tecta straight, less than 1/2 the radius, labra very thin, tectum-end indistinct. Area contagionis dark, arcuate ridges absent. Extrema lineamenta and the surface of the spore coat laevigate, exine thin showing a number of crescentic secondary folds. Dimensões Diâmetro total: SO^m - Sõ^m. Observação Calamospora saaríana difere de C. minuta Bharadwaj 1957 pela marca trilete menor. Holótipo Locus typicus. veio Walschied, Mina Gõttelborn, Saar, Alemanha. Stratum typicum: Westfaliano D-Estefaniano (Carbonífero Superior). Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 3-MC-3-SC (Matos Costa, Santa Catarina), T-8 (1 651,90m), Bacia do Paraná Repositório: PETROBRAS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP. 9304439), EF. N-36-4. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano (Artinskiano ao Kunguriano). Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Sphenophyta). Cannanoropollis diffusus (Tiwari) Dias-Fabrício 1981 1965: Parasaccites diffusus Tiwari Diagnosis Circular; central body ill-defined and exine thin with many microfolds. Y-mark generally not well-defined. Saccus narrow, uniform with radially arranged muri, zones of saccus attachment being diffused. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 91^m - 176^m. Eixo transversal: 67^m - 137prm. Eixo longitudinal do saco: 12^m - 35 ^m. Eixo transversal do saco: 12^m - 22 ^m. Observação Cannanoropollis diffusus difere de C. korbaensis (Bharadwaj & Tiwari) Foster 1975 pelo corpo central difuso e exina mais fina. O gênero Parasaccites foi sinonimizado com Cannanoropollis por questões de prioridade uma vez que as espécies-tipo não apresentam diferenças significativas (Foster, 1975). Holótipo Locus typicus: Mina Korba (NS/165/S2, poço K-63), índia. Stratum typicum: Andar Barakar. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 2-CS-1-PR (Chapéu do Sol), T-22 (2 392,30m), Bacia do Paraná. Repositório: PETROBRAS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP. 9303609), EF. V 27-4. Distribuição Estratigráfica Carbonífero Superior (Westfaliano) ao Permiano (Asseliano ao Kunguriano). Afinidade Botânica GYMNOSPERMAE (Coniferophyta ou Cordaitophyta). Cannanoropollis korbaensis (Bharadwaj & Tiwari) emend. 1964: Parasaccites korbaensis Bharadwaj & Tiwari 1975: Cannanoropollis sp. cf. C. korbaensis (Bharadwaj & Tiwari) Foster Diagnosis Pollen monosaccate, trilete. Amb circular to broadíy oval, periphery undulant. Laesurae distinct to perceptible, simple extending up to 1/2 of distance to corpus margin. Corpus circular to ovai (polar view), outline distinct: undetached exoexine oi corpus infrareticulate. thin. without marked folds or wrinkles; intexine smooth. 1Mm - 2^m thick. Saccus detached subequatorially from distai and proximal faces: line of detachment irregular. Detached exoexine overlapping outer 1/4-112 corpus radius- Saccus 2^m - 3^m thick, occasionally with strong radial folds; infrareticulum fine, densely packed Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 63^m (100) 184^m. Eixo transversal: 51/n (86) 134>m Observação A espécie C. korbaensis é similar a C. sp. cf. C. korbaensis de (Bharadwaj & Tiwari) Foster 1975. As espécies registradas na Bacia do Paraná são similares a Parasaccites korbaensis Bharadwaj & Tiwari 1964. De acordo com os critérios de Foster (1975). enquadra-se no gênero Cannanoropollis e não em Parasaccites Holótipo Locus typicus Setor Ghordewa (poço n° G-101) Mina Korba. índia. Stratum typicum Andar Barakar. Permiano Inferior. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 2-CN-1-SC (Canoinhas, Santa Catarina), T-14 (706,7m), Bacia do Paraná. Afinidade Botânica GYMNOSPERMAE (Coniferophyta ou Cordaitophyta) Cannanoropollis perfectus (Bose & Maheshwari) Dias-Fabrício 1981 1968: Parasaccites perfectus Bose & Maheshwari Diagnosis Miospores 79/^m - 98^m in diameter; central body distinct, roundly triangular to subcircular, 46^m - 56^m in diameter; trilete weakíy developed to distinct, rays all equal, upto 15^m long, uniformly broad, exine thin to medium-thick, intramicroreticulate: saccus uniformly broad, more than 1/2 body radius in extent from central body equator, frilled, subequatoriatly attached both proximally as well as distally, finely intrareticuiate, meshes radially oriented. Dimensões Diâmetro total: 78/zm - 98^m. Diâmetro do corpo : 46^m - 56p:m. Observação A espécie difere de C. fusus Tiwari & Foster (1975) por apresentar diâmetro menor e corpo central bem distinto. Holótipo Locus typicus: Luanda e tributário médio do rio Congo, África. Stratum typicum Permiano Inferior. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano ( Asseliano ao Artinskiano). Afinidade Botânica GYMNOSPERMAE (Coniferophyta ou Cordaitophyta). Columnisporites heyleri (Doubinger) emend. Alpern & Doubinger 1973 1968: Columnisporites heyleri Doubinger Diagnosis Elongated spore, outline more or less sinuous, more often trapezoidal. Monolete mark hardly visible. Proximal face flat or slightly incurved, distai face convex. The surface presents two systems of grooves and ridges. The ridges, 1.5^m-5^m thick are irregularly anastomosed and form a true reticulum more or less parallel to the major axis of the spore. The second system consists of finer ridges and grooves with a maximum thickness of 1^m ± perpendicular to the former. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 42^m - 73^m. Observação A marca monolete. de acordo com Alpern e Doubinger (1973), nunca se apresenta muito vtsívei, por se apresentar, normalmente, na parte achatada do esporo. Holótipo Locus typicus: Camada de Veuvrotte, Bacia de Autun, França. Stratum typicum: Autuniano Inferior. Distribuição Estratigráfica Carbonífero Superior (Westfaliano) ao Permiano (Asseliano/Kunguriano). Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Filicophyta). Complexisporites polymorphus Jizba 1962 y X Diagnosis Laesurate; fissures vary in number and form. A circular groove encloses the fissured portion of the body. Diameter of area enclosed by groove equals about 3/4 of the body width and is a few «m shorter than the body length At least one fissure is present, in which case it is median, longitudinal and extends to the groove; the fissure may bifurcate to produce triradiate and other forms. Other fissures may be present; they are usually longitudinal and extend to the groove. Fissure width Vm - 2,um , with - 22^m (usually 10 - 12) ^m spacing. Body subcircutar; reticulate-granulose sexine structure evident in well preserved specimens. Distai furrow distinct; body usually lacks folds. Sacei crescent-shaped (lenght: width about 1:2); maximum saccus width measured along the distai line of attachment is slightly less than body width. In polar view, area of one saccus equals 2/3 - 3/4 body area. Very mild distai inclination; furrow width variable. Sacei internally reticulate; distai meshes isodiametric, proximal muri strongly radially aligned. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 49^m (58) 86íím. Eixo transversal: 33,?.m (45) 55„.m. Diâmetro do corpo: 28^m (46) 55 ^m. Observação A espécie é caracterizada pela presença do sulco circular envolvendo o corpo, pela forma dos sacos e a disposição assimétrica das estrias, sendo muito similar a lllinites unicus Kosanke 1950. Holótipo Locus typicus. Coal balis a 2’ da camada de carvão que está 13' abaixo do Saddle CK 1s. mbr. Texas, USA. Stratum typ/cu/77.Permiano(?), Wolfcampiano (?). Distribuição Estratigráfica Carbonifero Superior (Westfaliano) ao Permiano Inferior (Asseliano ao Artinskiano). Afinidade Botânica Desconhecida. Convolutispora candiotensis Ybert 1975
Diagnosis Spores trilete, amb subtriangular, strongly convex sides and rounded ápices Laesura sometimes obscured by sculpture. Laesura straight or slightly sinuous extending to 1/2 - 2/3 radius. Exine sculptured by sinuous rugulae commonly anastomosed resembling a reticulum pattern. Rugulae 2^m -3^m wide, intercaleted by narrow vermiculi 0.5 - 2.0 wide. Rugulae forming an undulating shape on outline. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 40Mm - 60Mm. Observação C. candiotensis difere de C. tessellata pela presença de um padrão mais grosseiro do retículo. Holótipo Locus typicus: Candiota-S.F-2-AC -11,42m - 12,90m, Bacia do Paraná, Rio Grande do Sul, Brasil. Stratum typicum'. Formação Rio Bonito, Permiano Inferior. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano (Artinskiano ao Kazaniano). Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Filicophyta). Convolutispora tessellata Hoffmeister, Staplin & Malloy 1955 Diagnosis Spores radiai, trilete; originally spherical; outline circular to subcircular, conspicuous folding lacking: ornamentation thick, irregular, partly anastomosing, broad ridges of variabíe width and height, narrow to rounded in profile; trilete suture present but obscured by ornamentation; spore coat relatively thick, translucent; diameter 45/zm - 86Mm, ridges 2.8^m - 6.5/>m wide, 2Mm - 5.6/ím high. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 45;jm - 86^m. Observação A espécie apresenta, além da ornamentação distinta de C.candiotensis, diâmetro equatorial menor. Holótipo Locus typicus'. TCO-82, 2 087 pés - 2 088 pés, Formação Hardinsburg, U.S.A. Stratum typicum: Mississipiano. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 2-CS-1-PR (Chapéu do Sol), T-14 (2 260,80m), Bacia do Paraná. Repositório: PETROBRAS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP. 9303403), EF. W36-3. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano Superior (Ufimiano/Kazaniano). Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Filicophyta), Diagnosis Spores trilete, amb subtriangular with convex sides and rounded ápices. Intexine attached or not to the ectexine. Laesura with raised lips with slight verrucae or spines near pole extending to the ápices or to the equatorial margin. Proximal view with sparsely spines straight or curved, sometimes bifurcated. Associated to the spines sometimes occur verrucae and grana. The spines become longer and finer (7^m x 1Mm in basal diameter) near the margin. Cingulizone large, thicker in the inner margin and sometimes wider on the ápices, sometimes with radial thickenings extending to the margin, forming papilla or verrucae, cingulizone with marginal grooves lobate irregularly; surface cingulum sculptured by sparsed grana, verrucae near the margin that can be sometimes thickened; margin entire or sculptured by spines and coni. Distai face with coarse elements, sparsely distributed, besng smaller on polar region and larger and thicker on equatorial zone. Elements wide on basal part and pointed or rounded, acuminate, widest ones ending in rounded ápices. The elements can fuse Iaterally forming ridges. Among the elements there are few verrucae. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 60^,m - 94;zm. Largura da cingulizona: 12/jm - 23/jm. Observação A designação foi dada em alusão aos lábios espessados das laesurae. Cristatisporites inconstans Archangelsky & Gamerro 1979 apresenta cingulizona completa. Holótipo Locus typicus: Poço YPF Cd O es 1 - Córdoba - Bacia Chaco-Paraná, Argentina. Stratum typicum: Formação Ordonez, Permiano. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 3-MC-3-SC (Matos Costa, Santa Catarina), T-10 (1 719,80m), Bacia do Paraná. Repositório: PETROBRÁS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP. 9304443), EF. S 35. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano. Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Lycophyta). Diagnosis Spore trilete, amb subtriangular, rounded ápices. Laesurae with raised lips straight to slightly sinuous extending to the inner part of the zone Proximal view smooth or punctate; small spines (less than 1 ^m) occur near the margin. Cingulizone thick on inner margin and thin on outer margin. Cingulizone commoniy incomplete, sometimes more developed on ápices, with large spines and pointed or mammoid bacula. Distai face with coarse elements forming mammoid ridges, sometimes with large rings. Margin sculptured by large spines, commoniy mammoid extending to the zone. Intexine generally attached to the ectexine. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 60pm - 88am. Observação Esta espécie caracteriza-se principalmente pela zona incompleta, lábios menos desenvolvidos e ornamentação distai geralmente envolvendo amplas auréolas. Holótipo Locus typicus: Poço YPF Cd O es 1 - Córdoba - Bacia Chaco-Paraná. Argentina. Stratum typicum: Formação Ordonez. Permiano. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência Poço 3-MC-3-SC (Matos Costa, Santa Catarina), T-13 (1 755,30m), Bacia do Paraná Repositório: PETROBRÁS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP. 9304444), EF. X 28-4. Distribuição Estratigráfica Carbonifero Superior (Westfaliano) ao Permiano (Asseliano/Artinskiano). Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Lycophyta).
Diagnosis Spore trilete, amb subtriangular to subcircuíar. Intexine attached or not to the ectexine. Laesura with proeminent tips slightly sinuous reaching or not the outer margin of the zone. Proximal surface ornamented by scattered verrucae with 2.5>m in basa! diameter near the pole; near the equator the verrucae and spines (with 2^m height) are closely distributed. Cingulizone large with some vacuoles radially elongated, with smooth surface or scattered grana', equatorial margin with spines, coni, papilla, acuminate or not or irregularly undulated. Distai face with large flattened elements on pole (3.5^m - 4^m), sinuous or horseshoe in shape Near the equator the elements are verrucae-mammoids (and in some parts of cingulizone) and in the equator are verrucae-baculate up to 11^m in height, with rounded ápices or slightly acuminate. Some verrucae may be present on distai face of the cingulizone. The elements sometimes can be coalescent. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 59um - 82_<m. Observação Cristatisporites lestai difere de C. labratus por este apresentar ornamentação distai mais desenvolvida e lábios da laesura com verrugas e espinhos. Difere de C. inconstans por este apresentar cingulizona incompleta e ornamentação distai que por vezes se funde formando auréolas. Holótipo Locus typicus: Poço YPF Cd O es 1 - Córdoba - Bacia Chaco-Paraná, Argentina. Stratum typicum: Formação Ordonez, Permiano. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 3-MC-3-SC (Matos Costa, Santa Catarina), T-10 (1 719,80m), Bacia do Paraná. Repositório: PETROBRAS/CENPES: lâmina palinológica (LP.9304443) EF. Z45-3. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano (Artinskiano/Kunguriano). Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Lycophyta). CATALOGO de esporos e pOlen fôsseis do paleozóico B. Geoci. PETROBRÁS, Rio de Janeiro, 9 (1): 1-151, jan./mar. 1995 Cristatisporites menendezii Playford 1978 1972: Ancistrospora verrucosa Menendez & Azcüy Diagnosis Spores radial, trilete; amb convexly subtriangular. Laesurae straíght or slightly sinuous; simple or acompanied by narrow elevated lips that are up to 2 /j.m wide overall; laesurae extend to inner margin of cingulum, or almost so. Prominent biform sculpture developed over whole of distai surface, including (and especially upon) cingulum, and often encroaching marginally on cinguíate proximai face. Sculpture consists of coarse mammoid verrucae with subcircular bases (diameter 3.5^m - lO^m, occasionally up to 17p<m) and height of ca. 2^m - 7^m. Verrucae discrete, also fused to form coarse sinuous ridge-like structures up to ca. 25^m long (usually much less). Sculpturaí elements normaíly equippedwith slender, spinose, accessory projections, 0.5^m - 1.5ptm broad basally, 1jzm -6.5miti high. Exine otherwise scabrate or finely, irregularly pitted (presumed corrosion effect). Intexinal body often evident, but only vaguely; usually in close proximity to outer layer. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 20,8^m - 35,3nm. Observação Playford (1978) considera Ancistrospora Menendez &. Azcuy (1971) como sinônimo de Cristatisporites por suas características de estrutura e escultura não justificarem uma nova categoria taxonômica diferente de Cristatisporites. Cristatisporites menendezii apresenta características diferentes daquelas de Cristatisporites verrucosus Gonzalez Amicón (1973), sendo por esta razão criado C. menendezii. Holótipo Locus typicus: Amostra FC P 1: 19 afloramento - Província de Ia Rioja-30°13' lat. S, 67°18r long. W, Argentina. Stratum typicum: Formação Lagares, Bacia de Paganzo, Carbonífero. Distribuição Estratigráfica Carbonífero (Namuriano), Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Lycophyta). Cristatisporites microvacuolatus (Dias-Fabrício) emend. Picarelli & Dias- Fabrício 1990 1981: Cristatisporites microvacuolatus Dias-Fabrício 1981: Cristatisporites variornatus Dias-Fabrício
Diagnosis Spore trilete, amb subtriangular, convex sides and rounded ápices. Laesura proeminent extending to the inner margin of the cingulizone, sculptured with small rounded verrucae and grana. Proximal view sculptured by small rounded verrucae (1.0^m lenght x 2.0^171 basal diameter), granula, coni and spines with 1.0/jm, closely packed near the laesura. Distai view ornamented by large flattened verrucae with mucronate ápices commonly joined (7.3pim - basal diameter; 2.5^171 height) evenly placed close to the distai pole and with internai structuration on microvacuoies; rounded verrucae with pointed ápices, isolated and placed near to the equatorial margin. Elements less than basal diameter apart. Cingulizone narrow (3.5^m - 4.8^07) sculptured by setose verrucae (3.ÕMm long x 1.0^m basal diameter), baculae (2.5^m long x 1.0 basal diameter), mammoid, sculptured at outer margin. The limit between the cingulizone and corpus is marked by small vacuoles. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 21/jm (31) 40p<m. Observação Esta espécie difere das demais descritas para o gênero pela estruturação interna das verrugas em microvacúolos. Holótipo Locus typicus'. Jazida de carvão de Morungava. sondagem 5CA-91-RS, Bacia do Paraná. Brasil. Stratum typicurrr. Formação Rio Bonito, Permiano Inferior. Picarelli & Dias-Fabrício 1990 1981: Crístatisporites morungavensis Dias-Fabrício Diagnosis Spore trilete, amb subcircular, convex sides and rounded ápices. Laesura extending to the inner margin of the cingulizone, labra sinuous sculptured by fine spines (basal diameter less than 1.0^m and 1.5fzm - 2.0^m height). Proximal view with grana, coni, spines and wide spaced pointed verrucae (lO^m - 2.0^m). Distai view with small verrucae (1 5^m - 2.0miti basal diameter x 1.5^m height) rounded to slightly mammoid. Verrucae regularly distributed and more or less basal diameter apart. The limit between the cingulizone and corpus is marked by small vacuoles. Cingulizone narrow (3.5^m - 4.2^m), serrate or complete; outer margin with spines (2.5Mm and less than 1.0^m basal diameter). Cingulizone sculptured by pointed or mammoid baculae, sparsely distributed. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 20,8^m - 35,3,um. Observação Esta espécie apresenta ornamentação menos densa em ambas as faces, diferindo assim de Crístatisporites microvacuolatus Picarelli & Dias-Fabrício 1990. Holótipo Locus typicus-. Cristatisporites spinosus (Menendez & Azcuy) Playford 1978 1972: Ancistrospora spinosa Menendez & Azcuy Diagnosis Spores radial, trilete; amb subtriangular to subcircular, laesurae straight extending 3/4 radius. Proximal view slightly punctate to microgranulate, distai view scuptured mainly by spinaé and coni fused to form a vermicular pattern. Equatorially sometimes appear the elements distally fused forming structures like ridges, limiting the distai and proximal faces. Exine two-layered, sometimes dettached. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 55^m (69-73) 82^01. Observação Playford (1978) considerou o gênero Ancistrospora Menendez & Azcuy (1972) como sinônimo de Cristatisporites devido a suas características estruturais e esculturais muito similares não justificarem o reconhecimento de outra categoria genérica. Assim, designou como Cristatisporites spinosus a espécie Ancistrospora spinosa. Holótipo Locus typicus: Amostra FC P 1: 19 afloramento-Província de la Rioja- 30°13' lat S, 67°18' long W, Argentina. Crucisaccites latisulcatus Lele & Maithy 1964 Diagnosis Size range about 200^m - 260m!H (along the longer axis), outline ± circular to oval, body 160/jn - 190^111 (along the longer axis), mediumly thick, clear, subcircular to ellipsoid in shape, exine structure or sculpture obscure, saccus outside the body narrow, more or less uniformly wide; zones of attachment nearly reaching the body periphery, bilateral cruciate with respect to each other on the two sides, saccus-free areas of body ± wide, thinner, su/cus-like; body-infolds near saccus roots strongly developed; monolete mark rarely visible, body exine in the saccus-free area may often rupture to simulate a monolete horizontal slit; saccus structure fine intrareticulate. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 20CC.m - 26Ccm. Diâmetro do corpo: 160/jm - 190um Observação C. latisulcatus difere de C. monoletus por apresentar o corpo central menor em relação ao diâmetro do pólen. PETROBRÂS, Rio de Janeiro, 9 (1): 1-151, jan./mar. 1995 Crucisaccites monoletus Maithy 1965 Diagnosis Size range about 120/2m -IGO^m (along longer axis), outline ± oval to circular, body 110/JTi -130^m (along longer axis) thin, distinct, circular or oval in outline, body ornamentation intramicroreticulate, saccus outside the body extremely narrow, more or less uniformly wide; zone of attachment nearly reaching the body periphery, bilateral, cruciate with respect to each other on the two sides, saccus free areas of body ± wide, thinner, sulcus-like; body infolds absent; an undoubted monolete mark demonstrable, sometimes the body exine in the saccus-free area may often rupture to a broad horizontal slit; saccus structure fine intra-reticulate. Dimensões Diâmetro total (eixo maior): 120^m - 160/zm. Corpo: 11O^m -130/jm. Observação Crucisaccites latisulcatus Lele & Maithy 1964 difere desta espécie pela presença de um corpo mais espesso, pregas no corpo e saco comparativamente mais amplo. Cycadopites glaber (Luber & Waltz) Hart 1965 1941: Azonaletes glaber Luber & Waltz Diagnosis The outline approaches an oval. There is a t-a elongation such that t-a: 1 -a is about 3:2, and the lateral margin is rounded when the furrow is closed and slightly flattened when it is open. The furrow extends to about the lateral margin and may be open or closed laterally; centrally it is about one-sixth to one-eighth 1-a wide and iaterally about one-quarter to one-fifth 1-a wide. The sculpture is laevigate. Dimensões Diâmetro: 43mITI. Observação A característica principal da espécie é a exina lisa. Afinidade Botânica Sem referência, provavelmente GYMNOSPERMAE. Cyclogranisporites gondwanensis Bharadwaj & Salujha 1963 Diagnosis Yellowish, circular miospores. Holotype 32^m. Trilete mark distinct, Y-arms generally going up to 3/4 the radius and mostly subdued by the closely set ornamentation, hence in many ofthe specimens studied, the exact nature ofthe rays notvery well ascertained, although the Y-mark discernible. Apparentltly in some of the cases two of the arms longer than the third one; however, this feature not appearing to be constant in all the specimens. Exine matted with uniformly set grana, ± Vm in size, generally 40-70 grana counted, on the equatorial margin. In smaíler specimens 40-50 grana on the margin and in the bigger specimens 60-70. In certain cases some of the grana confluent. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 22^m - 36^m. Holótipo Locus typicus: camada de carvão 8 da Jazida de carvão Raniganj, índia. Stratum typicum: Andar Raniganj, Permiano, Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 2-CN-1-SC (Canoinhas, Santa Catarina), T-17 (1 004,OOm). Bacia do Paraná. Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Filicophyta). Cyclogranisporites minutus Bharadwaj 1957 Diagnosis Circular spores of light yellow colour, usually flattened in equatorial plane when they may be subcircuíar due to secondary folding. Y-mark distinctly seen, apex and vertex low, labra thin, rays unequal, two being longer and well defined but the third is usually faint, ray ends drawn out, not bifurcate. Extrema lineamenta rough due to the presence of minute (less than 1/2Mm) grana. In surface view the spore coat appears pitted with grana located along the ridges enciosing the pits. Spore coat less than 1Mm in thickness. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 28^171 - 45;xm. Observação Cyclogranisporites minutus difere de Cyclogranisporites gondwanensis Bharadwaj & Salujha (1964) por apresentar dobras secundárias. Holótipo Locus typicus: veio Wahlschied, Mina Gõttelborn, Saar, Alemanha. Stratum typicum: Bacia carbonífera do Saar, Carbonifero Superior. Cyclogranisporites parvigranulosus (Leschik) Ybert 1975 1955: Punctatísporites parvigranulosus Leschik Diagnosis Spores triletes, amb circular, commonly folded. Laesurae straight or slightly sinuous. Labra thin. Laesurae extending 1/2 to 3/4 of the radius. Exine sculptured by minutely granulate elements scarcely distributed on distai and proximal view. Dimensões Diâmetro: 35^m (45) 80^. Observação Esta espécie difere de C. minutus Bharadwaj 1957 pela presença de maior número de pregas e ornamentação menos densa. Holótipo Locus typicus. Amostra 26a, argila com areia fina sobreposta à camada de carvão, Basel Neuerwelt, Suiça. Stratum typicum: Keuper (Triássico Médio a Superior). Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 2-CS-1-PR (Chapéu do Soí), T-22 (2 392,30m), Bacia do Paraná. Repositório: PETROBRAS/CENPES: lâmina palinoíógica (LP. 9303609), EF.V37-4. Distribuição Estratigráfica Carbonífero (Namuriano-Westfaliano) ao Permiano (Sakmariano-Artinskiano). Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA (Filicophyta). Florinites antiquus Schopf 1944 Diagnosis Pollen grains, bilateral symmetry, equipped with an annulate bladder joined to the central polen body only on the distai side, thus outlining a "contact area" equivalent to a germinal "furrow". The grains are broadly elliptical when compressed in the proximo-distal plane so that the length and breadth proportions are evident. When compressed laterally the axial dimension is observed to be shorter than that in either of the other two planes of symmetry. Inclusive of the bladder, the fossils range from 55 - 90 (mostly 65/zm - 85^m) in lenght, and 40 - 75 (mostly 45urn - 60/zm) in breadth. The axial dimension, exhibíted in a few instances, is a little less than 40Mm. The body, enclosed by the bladder on all but the distai side, is more nearly spherical ranging from 25 - 45 (mostly 27^m - 37^171) in length and 20 - 40 (mostly 25^m -35^m) in breadth. The axial dimension of the body is somewhat less, about 20^171 - 25.,..'m. The body proper is always compressed with sharp folds which are characteristically more numerous around the periphery: the bladder is oftentimes hardly folded when compression is in the proximo-distal plane, but the folding that does affect it is more erratic. When compressed obliquely or laterally the outline is much distorted The bladder membrane it self is less than a micron thick; a zone a few ^m broad around the equator is more definetely yellowish translucent and slightly thicker; compressed laterally the equatonal zone of the bladder remains distinguishable and the slight inequality in thickness evidently contributes to the more erratic character of folds. The bladder is smooth to minutely granulose extemally but shows an internai reticuíation net. The reticulae vary from 1^m - 3^m in diameter. and may be very slightly elongated radially. The bars of the reticuíation are not proeminent in this species and have a thickness of a fraction of a micron. The reticuíation is more pronounced away from the body and is hardly discernable immediately surrounding in the "contact area" on the distai side or centrally on the proximal side. The body wall is essentially smooth, very thin, and except where folded into several thicknesses, it hardly darkens the light straw-yellow translucence of the central area of the pollen grains. The "contact area" where bladder joins the body wall is elliptical or oval with its greater diameter commonly transverse to the lenght of the pollen grain. Themarginsof this area are quite faint and its size and outline vary from 17^m x 23mIti to 10^m x 20^m It can hardly be detected underthe microscope unless the grain is oriented distai side up. A distinct but tenuous striation transverses the "contact area" in many instances, continues on the bladder membrane until about opposite the body margin, and is then lost as the bladder membrane develops its more distinctive ornamentation. It can hardly be interpreted as a monolete suture line; it would seem more plausibly regarded as a harmomegathic groove similar m character to those on the distai side of Monoletes prepollen but more faintly developed, since the body and bladder membranes are not nearly so thick as the Monoletes coat. The striation seems correlated in position with the long axis of the contact area and frequently is set obliquely with reference to the breadth of the grain as a whole. Dimensões: Diâmetro total: 55^m - 90um . Diâmetro do corpo central: 25/jm - 45^m. Holótipo Locus typicus: 10-12 polegadas do carvão Wiley com ciclotema próximo ao topo do Grupo Tradewaterde lllinois, U.S.A. Stratum typicum: Allegheniano (Inferior). Florinites dissacoides Alpern 1959 Diagnosis Amb oval eiongated with a characteristíc strangulation at C.c. levei. C.c well defined perpendicular to long axis of the pollen, Y mark not visible. Saccus infrareticuiate resembling a subdivision in two sacci. 45/zm - 60^m x 30um x 40^m. C.c 15^m - 2CLun in diameter. Dimensões Diâmetro longitudinal: 45pim - 60p<m. Afinidade Botânica GYMNOSPERMAE (Cordaitophyta) Florinites occultus Habib 1966 Diagnosis Monosaccate pollen grains; roundly elliptical to subcircutar outline. Central body circular to oval, very thick and dark, probably over 2.5mID; an irregularly spinose or conate omamentation is distinct at its outline. Saccus externally laevigate and internally coarsely reticulate, reticulation pattern radiating out from area of central body; attached distally to central body, proximal side free; junction with saccus on distai side attended by an irregular gap, exposing central body; in some specimens, it is concentrically tom around the central body, presumably because of the latter structures thickness. A tetrad scar was observed in only one specimen, where a short. irregular trilete mark ís presenton the proximal (free) side ofthe saccus. Size range (eight specimens) 60,^.m - 106^m; central body 35,zm - 8CCm Dimensões Diâmetro total: 60;zm - 106^m. Diâmetro do corpo central: 35^m - 80gm. Observação Esta espécie é diferenciada das demais pela presença de um corpo escuro, espesso. Holótipo Locus typicus: veio de carvão do Lower Kithanning Inferior, Pennsylvania ocidental. U.S.A. PETROBRAS, Rio de Janeiro, 9(1): 1-151, jan./mar. 1995 Fusacolpites fusus Bose & Kar 1966 Diagnosis Pollen mostly ± oval, lateral ends perpendicular to the shorter axis ± equally rounded, sometimes one end is more pointed or flat than the other. Exine upto 2.5 thick, mostly intrapunctate, mesh-size ± 1.15^m, may be imperfectly intramicroreticulate in some specimens. Striations 10 -40 in number, deep, straight, parallel and extending from one end to the other províding uneven appearance on the lateral sides in most cases. Striations may, however, be ill-developed or wavy. In very rare cases one or two weakly developed vertical striations can hardly be recognised. Colpus extending from on end to the other, mostly ± uniformly broad and open but may be unequally broad or close at one end or constricted in the middle. margins of colpus ± smooth, mostly without any fold but in some cases semilunar, straight or irregular folds may be found on one or both the sides of the colpus. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 44^m - 48^m. Eixo transversal: 36miti - 44^m. Observação Fusacolpites fusus distingue-se de F. ovatus pela forma oval-fusiforme, estrutura intrapunctate, intramicrorreticulada e em média tamanho maior. Holótipo Locus typicus. Striations 8-15; not deep, ± straight, parallel, extending from one end to the other in most cases. Sometimes striations hardly traceable and wavy. Rio de Janeiro, 9(1): 1-151, jan./mar. 1995 Granulatisporítes absonus Foster 1979 Diagnosis Spores radial, trilete. Amb convexly subtriangular. Laesurae distinct, extending full distance to equator or almost so; accompanied by thin, narrow labra, 1/zm -2^m in overall height and width, with finely notched outer margins. Exine l^m -2,.;m thick, occasionally folded; comprehensive sculpture with varying proportions of grana, coni, bacula, and verrucae. Elements discrete, 2^70 or less in height and basal diameter, spaced O-õ^m - 3^m apart; sparser and smaller on proximal face. Verrucae and bacula confined mainly to equatorial region and, in polar view, impart a distinctly notched outline. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 20/zm (30) 43^171. Observação Esta espécie distingue-se das demais espécies assinaladas ao gênero pelo arranjo e diversidade dos elementos esculturais. Granulatisporites angularis Staplin 1960 Diagnosis Spores trilete. radial portions well-rounded without shoulders, sides slightly convex to straight; distai surface distinctly granulose, size of granules varies from specimen to specimen; proximal surface generaily laevigate, sutures distinct, sometimes with faint lips (oil), usually closed, ratio about 2/3; apical area faintly darkened; spore wall moderate in thickness, light brownish yellow; size 22^m - 26^m. Dimensões Diâmetro: 25^m - 42^m. Observação G, angularis é muito similar-a Granulatisporites trisinus Balme & Hennelly 1956, diferindo apenas pelo tamanho menor, Holótipo Locus typicus: Poço Imperial Belloy 12 -14. aos 4385', Alberta, Canadá. Granulatisporites trisinus Balme & Hennelly 1956 Diagnosis Amb triangular, sides slightly convex. Exine l^m - 2^m thick, sexine ornamented by regular, closely packed, rounded granules about 1^m in diameter and less than l^m apart. The ornament is not always distinguisable under low-power objectives and Oil immersion is necessary to resolve it fully. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 45pim (76) 11CÇm. Hamiapollenites bullaeformis (Samoilovich) Jansonius 1962 1953: Protodiploxypinus bullaeformis Samoiiovich Diagnosis The proxtmal cap shows ten to twelve longitudinal ribs in polar view. The distai keel is a single transverse thickening. The central body is either circular or has an 1-a elongation. Archangelsky & Gamerro 1979 1974: Hamiapollenites fusiformis Marques-Toigo Diagnosis Pollen disaccate, amb oval, dtploxylonoid. Ectexine (cappa) divided (11 -15) ín longitudinal taeniae (1.5 - 4.5 in width) separated by fine striae; taeniae dense and finely intrapunctate, some of them incomplete and short, pointed like a wedge between the larger ones. Distai leptome (cappula) with transverse thickening (6^m -11^m in width) running transversely across the centrai part of distai face. The thickening may be thin close to the central part, reduced to verrucae or even absent; the distai ectexine outside the central thickening is slightly rugulate. Sacei smaller than semi-circle, attached equatorially; intrareticuium ill-defined and obscure with intragranulate appearance. In some specimens sacei are reduced or absent Dimensões Diâmetro total: 52^m - 84,.m. Diâmetro do corpo: 26;.m - 60;<m. Largura do saco: 21^m-39^m. Comprimento do saco: 11,<m -21^m. Observação Esta espécie foi emendada na diagnose por Archangelsky & Gamerro (1979) em razão desses autoras observarem que, ao invés de duas tenias transversais, como consta da diagnose original, ocorre apenas uma tenia. CATÁLOGO DE ESPOROS E PÓLEN FÓSSEIS DO PALEOZÓICO B, Geoci PETROBRÁS Rio de Janeiro. 9 (1): 1-151. jan./mar 1995 Hoegiasaccites transitus Bose & Kar 1966 Diagnosis Small sized pollen grains, size range 50,um - 57^m x 44wm - 55míti. Central body 32Mm - 36^171 x 27^m - 32^m, mostly well defined, rarely indistinct; exine less than 2^m thick, finely intramicroreticulate, mostly covered by sacei on distai side. Monolete well developed, mostly straight, extending from one end of central body to the other; lip narrow, slightly elevated, straight, wavy or strongly curved. Sacei 23/zm x 48>m and 27^m x 55^m, semicircular, finely intrareticufate, mesh-size no more than 2^m, lumina shallow. Proximal attachment of sacei to central body equatorial, well or ill-defined; distally very closely placed, sometimes slightly overlapping or coalescent with each other, slit prominent, sometimes seem to be exo-exinous in origin, slit and monolete together form a well defined cross like strueture. Attachment zone straight, well defined, but may be fractured or distorted in some specimens, sometimes they form a very narrow boat shaped sulcus. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: SO^m - 75/^m. Kraeuselisporítes apiculatus Jansonius 1962 Diagnosis Size overall 56^m (62) 68^m; flange 3^m - 8Mm wide; overall outline subcircular, centrai part subcircular; flange may be more or iess well developed; proximal side almost flat, laevigate to scabrate; distally hemispherically, with many well developed spines (4mtti - 6,um, basis half total height) mostly on central part, rarely spreading onto flange, and then much smaller; Y mark narrow, not very distinct, reaching basis of flange, not extending onto flange but reflected in overall outline by small outward deflection. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: õO^m - 68/jm. Observação As formas identificadas com o K. apiculatus na Bacia do Paraná são idênticas às descritas por Jansonius (1962). para o Oeste do Canadá. Na Austrália essas formas foram colocadas como sinônimo de Indotrirradites Foster 1979. Holótipo Locus typicus'. Oeste do Canadá. Stratum typicum'. Triássico Inferior. Kraeuselisporites spinosus Jansonius 1962 >1 Diagnosis Size overall 42^m (51) 63p<m, flange 4^m - 9Mm wide; overall outline very rounded trianguiarto subcircular; central part rounded triangular, wall médium thick, color golden brown, dark secondary folding at base or flange; proximal face laevigate, distaily numerous widely spaced small spines (1/2^m - to large granules, on flange more widely spaced small granules; Y mark is usually distinct, narrow, rays reaching to base of flange. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 42^m (63) 85^m. Observação As espécies Kraeuselisporites spinosus, K. punctatus e K. apiculatus diferem essencialmente pelo tipo predominante de ornamentação. K. spinosus possui ornamentação intermediária entre K. punctatus e K apiculatus. Holótipo Locus typicus Área Peace River, Imp Pan. Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA. Kraeuselisporites splendens (Balme & Hennelly) Segroves 1970 1956: Cirratriradites splendens Balme & Hennelly Diagnosis Amb circular to rounded triangular. Exine cavate and consisting of a zonate exoexine enclosing a thin exine. Trilete; laesura faint to distinct, laesura arms usually including narrow, elevated lips which may extend onto zona and reach periphery of spore. When present lips about 1^m - 3^m wide. Width of zona sometimes characterized by translucent or dark, radially arranged thickemngs, which may merge and form a dark zone composing the inner 1/3 of the zona. Distai face of spore hemispherical, proximal face flattened pyramidal. Exoexine Vm - 2^m thick on distai face, and somewhat thinner on proximal face. Sculpture quite varied, with distai face reticulate, or bearing grana, verrucae, cones and occasionally spines. Sculpture may occur on distai surface of zona. Grana and verrucae 0.5Mm - 1.5^m high, O.S^m - 2^m in basal diameter, and O.S^m - 2^m apart. Cones and spines Vm - 8^m high, 0.5/zm - 3Mm in basal diameter, and 0.5Mm - 6^m apart. Exoexine of proximal face psilate and only rarely bearing a few cones or spines. tntexine about O.S^m thick. smooth-walled, and folded, Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 65^m a 126miti. Observação A característica que distingue esta espécie das demais identificadas neste gênero consiste na presença de processos grandes e achatados, que poderíam representar remanescentes de cones e espinhos. Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA Laevigatosporítes vulgaris (Ibrahim) Alpern & Doubinger 1973 1932: Sporonites vulgaris Ibrahim Diagnosis Monolete spore. aperture straight or curved, often distinct and fine. Exine generally thin but sometimes rather thick. Equatorial outline oval, meridian section bean-shaped. Axes ratio (width/lenght) varies between 0.4 and 1. The value 1 corresponds to the old genus Latosporites. Exine laevigate, aiways without sculpture. When the exine is thin it may be more or less folded. Dimensões Eixo transversal: 23^m - 52^m. Eixo longitudinal: 30nm - 90/zm. Observação O gênero Latosporites, que apresentava uma proporção semelhante entre os eixos de 0,4 a 1, foi invalidado. Diagnosis Size 54^m - 79^m, corpus 24^m - 40^m, oval outline, darkly colored in relation to the saccus, laesura proximal generally straight or inclined; rarely with a short third ray Endexine thick, commonly distai and endexine coated by a fine reticulum on distai side, absent on some specimens. Attachment lines generally bordered by transversal folds. Sacei a little more flat than Endexine commonly detached from corpus. so that the sacei is attached by a narrow bladder. Distinct sacei, large than corpus, light, with a coarse reticuíation pattem (brochi I.SmHI - 3Mm in diameter) radially arranged and with radial folds. Dimensões Diâmetro total: 49um - 97,2171. Diagnosis Pollen bisaccate. Central body circular or oval. Lunatisporites noviaulensis (Leschik) Foster 1979 1956: Taeniasporites noviaulensis Leschik Diagnosis Pollen disaccate, taeniate weakly diploxylonoid with transversely oval amb. Corpus distinct, transversely oval, exine 1^m - 2A<m thick. Cappa smooth or finely infrastructured, dissected by 3 or 4 broad clefts, each 1^m - 5^m wide, into 4 (rarely 5) taeniae, each 5^m - 10^m in width. Taeniae extend overful breadth oi corpus, parallel sided, very rarely branched. Sacei greater than semicircular in outline, distally inclined discrete. Saccus exoexine 2^m - 3^m thick, infrastrueture coarse; brochi polygonal to radially elongate. 2wm - 3^m in diameter Cappula rectanguiar, extending over full lenght of corpus, breadth ca. 1/3 -1/2 that of corpus, frequently bordered on either side by a single longitudinal fold, each ca 4^m wide. Cappula exine very thin, frequently torn. No well defined monolete mark was observed on any of the described specimens. Dimensões Diâmetro total: eô^m - 74^01. Largura do saco: 26wm - 29^m. Largura da cápula: 13^m - 1 S^m. Diâmetro do corpo central: 36^m - 47Mm. Observação A espécie distingue-se pela presença de tenias mais largas e em menor número. Lunatisporites rhombicus Bharadwaj & Tiwari 1977 Diagnosis Diploxylonoid, central body rhomboidal with rounded, narrow lateral ends, 44^m - 48^m x 5Vm - 60^m. Proximally 4-6 clear strips (taeniae) with microintrareticulate structure: one of the strips could be half ofthe body width in length. At times one or more taeniae may get folded. Distai sulcus marked by G^m - 8Mm wide lunar folds at the saccus bases. Dimensões Eixo maior: 68.xm - 85^m. Eixo menor: 51Mm - 60^171. Marques-Toigo & Picarelli 1984 1965: Densosporites braziliensis Pant & Srivastava 1975: Lundbladispora braziliensis (Pant e Srivastava) Marques-Toigo & Pons Diagnosis Spores radial, trilete, cavate, cingulate. Amb convexly subtriangular; biconvex in equatorial view with distai face strongly arched. Triiete soar indistinct or clearly defined, lips sometimes present, laesurae slightly sinuous, extending almost to the equatorial margin, Exoexine thick, proximal face laevigate or minutely scabrate. distai face and cingulum echinate (oil immersion/SEM). The sculptural elements are coalescent, l^m - 4^m in basal diameter and 1.5^m -4.5ptm in length. Intexine distinct, smooth and thin-walled, commonly attached to exoexine at proximal pole: mostly non-papillate. very rarey with three interradial papillae at proximal pole. Cingulum equatorially thickened, 4Mm - 12Mm wide. Proximal face of cingulum sculptured with grana and verrucae, outer margin with echinae. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 60^m (81-83) 109^m. Observação Pant & Srivastava (1965) descreveram uma nova espécie, Densosporites braziliensis, para amostras de carvão do Brasil. A espécie foi novamente mencionada em 1967 por Tiwari & Navale nas mesmas amostras. Marques-Toigo & Pons (1975) propõem uma nova combinação para Densosporites braziliensis já que as características observadas eram comparáveis ãs do gênero Lundbladispora Balme 1963. A espécie Lundbladispora braziliensis tem ampla distibuição estratigráfica nos sedimentos permianos da Bacia do Paraná, no Sul do Brasil, principalmente nas associações microflorísticas identificadas nos carvões e rochas associadas da Formação Rio Bonito. Santa Catarina) T-10( 1 719,80m), Bacia do Paraná. Lundbladispora iphilegna Foster 1979 Diagnosis Spores radiai, trilete, cavate, cingulate. Amb subcircular to subtriangular. Laesurae well defined, extending full distance to equator; accompanied by narrow, sinuous labra, 1^m - 2/j.m in overalí width and height, that are often corroded. Exoexine finely textured with spongeous appearance; less than 1Mm thick, except for well defined. ± unstructured, equatorial thickening, ca 1.5^m - 3mIti in width. Proximal face laevigate or finely granulate (oil immersion/SEM): remainderof exoexine bearing spinae, mammoid processes, and low verrucae (in varying proportions), elements are mostly discrete, few are coalescent, basal lenght up to 7^m ; ca 1^m - 2.5^m in height and basal diameter, spaced 1^m - 6^m apart. Intexine very thin. often folded; commoniy attached to exoexine very thin, often folded: commoniy attached to exoexine at proximal pole (and may have gaping trilete mark), rarely entireiy detached; mostly non-papillate. very rarely with 3 interradial papillae {ca 3^m in diameter) at proximal pole. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: SO^m (59) 78^m. Observação Distingue-se de L. braziliensis e L. riobonitensis pelo tipo de ornamentação. Lundbladispora riobonitensis Marques-Toigo & Picarelli 1984 Diagnosis Spores radial, trilete, cavate, cingulate. Amb convexly subtriangular, biconvex in equatorial view. Trilete soar indistinct or clearly defined, laesurae slightly sinuous accompanied by narrow labra, extending to the cingulum and equatorial margin. Exoexine thick, proximal face finely textured with spongy appearence (oil immersion/SEM). Cingulum bearing cones and few spinae confined to the outer margin. Intexine thin, indistinct, smooth, attached to exoexine at the proximal pole. Cingulum equatorially thickened, 4^m - 9^m wide. Marsupipollenites striatus (Balme & Hennelly) Hart 1965 1956: Marsupipollenites triradiatus forma striatus Balme & Hennelly Diagnosis The outline is oval. There are distinct foids bordering the transverse distai sulcus. On the proximal face there is a small trilete aperture. The sculpture on the proximal surface consists of curved striae and ribs that tend to parallel the sutures of the trilete aperture. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 25^m (40) 65/jm. Marsupipollenites triradiatus Balme & Hennelly 1956 Diagnosis Amb of unexpanded grain oval. Distai furrow bordered by two longitudinal overfolds in exine extending full length of the grain. Small trilete tetrad scar on proximal face, rays of scar about 6Mm long, sometimes open forming a triangular rent of the exine at the proximal pole. Expanded grain subcircular. distai side rupture bordered by a narrow zone of folded exine. Exine about 2 ^m thick on proximal face ornamented with flattened verrucae, granules or fine indeterminate markings. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 25^m (40) Sõ^m. Eixo transversal: 42Mm (51) 43^m. Observação A disposição dos elementos intra-estruturais da exoexina na espécie M triradiatus é distinta daquela de M. striatus Balme & Hennelly 1956. Nesta última espécie, os elementos da exoexina se dispõem em fileiras, simulando pseudotenias, Holótipo Locus typicus'. veio aos 688 pés, sul de Wallarah, poço n° 5 bore, N.S.W. Distribuição Estratigráfica Permiano Superior (Ufimiano). Afinidade Botânica GYMNOSPERMAE. Plicatipollenites densus Srivastava 1970 Diagnosis Central body is circular, sometimes subcircular. Holotype is 48^m in diameter and is distinctly defined, dense and dark brown in colour. Saccus width is usually more than 3/4 of the body radius; attached equatorially over the proximal face, width almost 20^m, and distaliy subequatorial, slightly away from the body equator, almost 23jam wide. Saccus encroachment on the distai side does not exceed 1/4 of body radius and is always associated with a circular, 2^m - 5^m thick body fold system which is placed slightly away from the body equator. Saccus is mediumly coarse, intrareticulate, muri are disposed radially; meshes do not exceed 2.«m in size. Outline is frilled and undulated. Dimensões Diâmetro total: 70ym - 130/im. Diâmetro do corpo: 40Mm - Sõ^m. Observação Esta espécie se caracteriza pela presença de um corpo denso. Holótipo Locus typicus'. Bacia Goraia South Rewa Gondwana, índia. PETROBRÁS, Rio de Janeiro, 9 (1): 1-151, jan./mar. 1995 Plicatipollenites gondwanensis (Balme & Hennelly) Lele 1964 1956: Nuskoisporites gondwanensis Balme & Hennelly Diagnosis Know size range 94um -134/jm (mean size 120^m x 110^m ), outline + circular; known size range of body 5Vm - 98^.m x 47mIti x 94Mm (mean size 72^m x 70Mm), outline circular to subcircular, distinct; fine intramicroreticulate, trilete mark weakfy developed or invisible, ± 1/2 body radius, length of rays or angles between them ± equai, sac relativeiy broader in comparison to body radius, known range of sac width 11/zm - 35/2m (usually above 1/2 body radius) distai saccus overlap more than 1/3 of body radius, body infold system well-developed, typically ± polygonal, outer limit of body infold system tends to lie well apart from body periphery, sac intrareticulate, muritend to be radiaíly elongated, outline of sac ± undulated. Dimensões Diâmetro total: 74^m - 210^m. Corpo central: 60^m - 122^m. Observação Plicatipollenites gondwanensis difere de Nuskoisporites triangularis por possuir um sistema de pregas poligonais no corpo central, enquanto que N. triangularis não possui qualquer sistema de pregas. Plicatipollenites indicus difere de P. gondwanensis principalmente por apresentar um sistema de pregas mais ou menos circular, situadas muito próximas à periferia do corpo central. Plicatipollenites malabarensis (Potonié & Sah) Foster 1975 1960: Cannanoropollis malabarensis Potonié & Sah Diagnosis Size varies from 103^m - 146/zm; equator circular ot little subtriangular; extrema lineamenta ± irregularly notched. Between central area and saccus a darker circular band may be seen: ín such cases breadth ofthe saccus outside the dark circle ± one third of the radius of the entire specimen; lumina of infrareticulation mostly circular, separated by muri appearing ± as broad as lumina', infrareticulation finer in central body, chiefly in its centre; lumina very sharp and fine in L position. Y-mark faint and narrow, mostly seen but not always, rays ± one-third to a little more than one-half of the radius of the central area. Dimensões Diâmetro total: 103^m (124) 146^m. Diâmetro do corpo central: 73^m (82) 92um. Largura do saco: 12/zm (16) 19jum. Plícatipollenites trígonalis Lele 1964 Diagnosis The grains are distinguished by their distinct, triangular to roundly triangular body which is occasionally ± denser than the surrounding sac. The sac is circular or roundly triangular in outline with the result that in certain specimens in which the sac is more circular and the body has flatter sides, the sac appears comparatively narrower at the angles ofthe body. The trilete mark is usually well seen and the rays generally, though not as a rule, point the interradial angles. The body is externally smooth and internally shows a fine intra-microreticulate structure. The body infold system is typically triangular in outline and the three fold components are disposed along the three sides of the body. Occasionally, however, at some of or all the three angles of the body, additional folds may develop and connect the major lateral fold components. Thus, the infold system may appearto be made up of three lateral and 1 - 3 angular components. Dimensões Diâmetro total: 94^m - 145^m. Diâmetro do corpo: 60^m - 90.um. Observação A espécie se distingue das demais referidas ao gênero por apresentar corpo mais ou menos triangular e um sistema de pregueamento que acompanha o seu contorno. Potonieisporites brasiliensis (Nahuys, Alpern & Ybert) Archangelsky & Gamerro 1979 1968: Vestigisporites brasiliensis Nahuys, Alpern & Ybert Diagnosis Pollen monosaccate, amb oval to subquadrangular, central body (intexine) subcircular to oval, thin and folded; commonly present two lateral folds transverse to the longitudinal axis or other small one. Corpus with monolete mark, rarely diiete or trilete with one ray shorter than the others ( 1/4 to 1/3 diameter), Ectexine slightly intrafrilled on distai and proximal view. Saccus attached on the subequatorial surface and overlapping + 1/4 of pollen diameter. Leptoma on distai face similar to corpus shape bordered by a folded distai root. Outline of pollen slightly undulating Saccus coarsely intrareticuiate with smaller mesh radially elongate at saccus margin. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 108/zm (110) ISS^m. Eixo transversal: 72^m (75) 110^m. Diâmetro do corpo central: 40/zm (55) 103ptm. Observação P. brasiliensis difere de P. novicus por apresentar as dobras do corpo central acompanhando seu próprio contorno. Em P. novicus, em geral, ocorrem dois sistemas de pregas onde um acompanha o corpo central e no outro as pregas são transversais e próximas ao centro do corpo (dobras secundárias). PETROBRÁS, Rio de Janeiro, 9 (1): 1-151, jan./mar. 1995 Potonieisporites grandis Tschudy & Kosanke 1966 Diagnosis These monosaccate prepollen are oval to elliptical in proximo-distal view. The body is brown to dark brown and has a distinct monoiete aperture oriented in the long axis and extending the entire length of the body. Lips are characteristically present and longitudinal folds of the body occur adjacent to the lips. Some overlap of the bladder on the proximal surface may occur at the equator. The bladder is internally reticulate. The known size range is 105/201 - 132/2m in overall lenght and the variation in width is 72,um -1 tO^m. The known variation in body length is 81 ;zm - 94ym and in width is 42^m - 67^01. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 105^01 - 132jum. Eixo transversal: 72/2m - 110^m. Potonieisporites methoris (Hart) Foster 1975 1960 Vestigisporites methoris Hart 1969: Potonieisporites balmei (Hart) Segroves Diagnosis Pollen monosaccate with straight or geniculate tetrad mark. Amb transversely oval, bilaterally symmetrical. Laesura simple, lenght 1/4 - 1/2 of corpus breadth; commissure open. Corpus oval, transversely elongate (polar view); exoexine of corpus breath; commissure open. Corpus oval, tranversely elongate (polar view); exoexine of corpus thin inframicrovermiculate or infrapunctate; intexine ca. 2^m thick, smooth with distai saccus root; occasionally a third peripheral fold developed parallel to major axis. Folds associated with distai saccus root; occasionally a third peripheral fold developed parallel to major axis. Saccus with slight distai inclination; detachment subequatorial, distai overlap (ca. 1/4 -1/2 corpus radius) greater than proximal. Saccus infrareticulum fine to moderately coarse; brochi Vm - S^m in diameter, radially elongate. Transverse width of saccus ca. 3/5 of corpus breadth, lateral width ca. 1/5 -1/2 of corpus lenght. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 65^m (80) 115jzm. Eixo transversal: 42^m (55) 67Mm. Diâmetro do corpo central: SO^m (45) 58^01. Observação Potonieisporites methoris difere de P. brasiliensis pelo tipo de dobras na exina do corpo central e largura dos sacos no eixo transversal. Em P. brasiliensis as dobras são aproximadamente circulares, contornando o corpo central, enquanto que em P. methoris as dobras são paralelas ao eixo maior do corpo central. Potonieisporites neglectus Potonié & Lele 1961 Diagnosis Central body often more oval to trapezoid (in P. novicus more circular); monolete mark sometimes replaced by a very asymmetrical trilete mark (not so in P. novicus), but there are still many cases with monolete mark; if the tetrad mark tends to be a trilete mark, it is always an asymmetric one where all the three rays are ± of differentt length. The saccus surrounding the central body is relatively narrower on the longer sides of the extreme equator than in P. novicus. The foid-rim surrounding the central body is often well seen. The two transverse folds are not, as a rule, placed away from the equator of the central body. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 104^m- 176^m. Potonieisporites novicus Bharadwaj 1954 Diagnosis Míospore oval in outíine with rounded saccus and central body oval or elliptical. Central body 2/3 of total diameter of spore. Laesura extending 1/3 of longitudinal axis of corpus. Saccus and central body oval or elliptical. Grains commonly flattened equatorialíy. Central body with translucent and thin wall. Polar view with two concentrics series of folds; one bordering periphery of corpus and other close the center. Central body proximal surface free from saccus with a distinct monolete mark and proeminent labra. Saccus light brown, intrareticulate. Dimensões Diâmetro total: 138ízm -170^m x 90^m - 140^m. Observação Bharadwaj (1954) criou o gênero Potonieisporites e o designou como espécie-tipo Potonieisporites novicus. Em 1955, erroneamente o designou como P. saarensís, que está invalidado. Muitas vezes, torna-se difícil separar P. novicus de P. neglectus, principaimente porque as formas gonduânicas (P. neglectus} apresentam muitas transições com formas de Potonieisporites novicus do Carbonifero da Europa. PETROBRÁS, Rio de Janeiro, 9(1): 1-151, jan./mar. 1995 Protohaploxypinus bharadwajii Foster 1979 Diagnosis Pollen protodisaccate, taeniate, haploxylonoid to slightly diploxylonoid. Corpus usually well defined, longitudinally oval: narrow, breadth equai to 0.7 x length or less. Cappa Vm - 2>zm thick, occasionally with irregularly developed marginal crest; divided into 5-11 taeniae by narrow clefts, each less than 0.5^m wide. Taeniae finely infrareticulate to infrapunctate (surface view), 2^m -7^m wide; seldom branched, continuous over full breadth of corpus, lying parallel or slightly obliquely to transverse axis. Sacei semicircular or greater in outline, distally inclined, discrete or continuous along lateral margins of corpus. Infrastructure of protosaccate exoexine fine to moderately coarse, appearing infrapunctate or infrareticulate in surface view Cappula rectangular or oval, extending over full length of corpus, breadth ca 1/3 that of corpus, often bordered by longitudinal intexinal folds: occasionally enclosing a narrow, longitudinally oríented sulcus. Exine of cappula thin, often torn. Dimensões Diâmetro total: 100^m - 126^m. Observação Distingue-se de outras espécies de Protohaploxypinus pelo corpo alongado longitudinalmente. número de estrias. zona distai estreita e cápula extensa. Protohaploxypinus goraiensis (Potonié & Lele) Hart 1964 1961: Lunatisporites goraiensis Potonié & Lele Diagnosis Distinctíy haploxylonoid in outline. The central body is circular or has a t-a elongation. The proximal cap possesses seven to eight longitudinal ribs in polar view. The sacei are about semi-circular in shape and about the same size as the central body. The distai zone is narrow, about one fifth 1-a (C.B.) or less. The sacei more or less join laterally but do not form lateral bladders. Dimensões Diâmetro total: 100,um - 126,um. Cappula well defined, rectangular, extending narrow folds lying parallel to longitudinal axis: breath equal near margins, becoming smooth and unstructured towards Diagnosis Pollen disaccate, taeniate, haploxylonoid or very weakly diploxylonoid. Corpus longitudinally elongate with distinct rectangular outline. Cappa ca. Vm thick, divided into 5 - 8 taeniae, each 2Mm - 8um wide. Taeniae finely and distinctly infrapunctate to infrareticulate, usually of ± constant width but occasionally wedge-shaped, extending overfull breadth of corpus, separated by narrow clefts less than 1Mm wide. Sacei semicircular or greater in outline, discrete or Iaterally connected by narrow strips of exoexine, distally inclined Saccus exoexine 1^m - 2^m thick, finely infrapunctate but readily corroded and appears coarsely over full length of corpus, margins often bordered by to 1/3 -1/2 of corpus. Cappula exine faintly struetured centre; less than 1^m thick. frequently torn orfolded. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 51Mm - 89^m. Diâmetro do corpo: 27^m - 44^m. The distai roots have attachment lines. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 65Mm - 90/zm. Eixo transversal: 42/^m - 53Mm. Diâmetro do corpo central: 40^ - õO^m. Observação Esta espécie difere das outras espécies de Protohaploxypinus pela presença de linha de ligamento na raiz distai. Holótipo Locus typicus: Lower Triassic of Western Canadá. Stratum typicum: Triássico. Espécime Figurado Ocorrência: Poço 2-CN-1-SC (Canoinhas, Santa Catarina), T-14 (706,7m), Bacia do Paraná. Afinidade Botânica GYMNOSPERMAE (Glossopteridophyta). Protohaploxypinus varíus (Bharadwaj) Balme 1970 1962: Faunipollenites varíus Bharadwaj Diagnosis Disaccate, haploxylonoid. Corpus poorly defined, circular to oval with a slight transverse or longitudinal elongation. Exine of cappa about 1ym thick, exoexine intrareticulate or intravermiculate with clearly defined structural elements, intexine very thin, translucent. Cappa divided into 6-9 taeniae by well-defined clefts, which are sometimes branched to give wedge-shaped taeniae Sacei almost hemispherical in polar view, saccus exoexine 2^m - 3^m thick, strongly and coarsely intrareticulate, brochi diameter 2^m - 4^171 with slight radial elongation near the proximal sacei bases. Cappula parallel-sided, breadth about one-half that of corpus, exine of cappula thin, translucent, usually faintly wrinkled. Dimensões Eixo longitudinal: 78^171 (86) 92^m. Corpo: 48^m (56) 65^m. Observação Hart (1964) considerou o gênero Faunipollenites Bharadwaj (1962) como sinonimizável com o gênero Protohaploxypinus Samoilovich 1953, dadas as características muito similares entre ambos. Punctatisporites gretensis forma minor Hart 1965 Diagnosis Laevigate Triletes, the sutures extend about three-quarters radius and have labra. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 45p<m (62) 114Mm. Observação Punctatisporites gretensis forma minore separada de P. gretensis pelo tamanho menor observado na média dos exemplares. Esta forma é muito comum nas associações palinológicas da Formação Rio Bonito, no Sul do Brasil, Bacia do Paraná. Reticulatisporites pseudopalliatus Staplin 1960 Diagnosis Spores trilete; circular; reticulate, muri 1.2/zm - wide, up to 3.7/2m high, overall surface including muri very finely granulose (oil); sutures simple, ratio about 2/3; light brownish yellow. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 48Mm - 66^m. Observação Esta espécie se caracteriza pela presença de fina granulação, tanto na exina das lumina como nos muri. Holótipo Locus typicus'. Retusotriletes golatensis Staplin 1960 Diagnosis Spores trilete; outline circular; surface finely and densely granulose (oil); * equator of spore slightly thickened, specially at the radial angles; three large contact areas outiined by the sutures and curvaturae at the inner edge ofthe marginal thickening; sutures with broad raised lips, extending almost to the thickened margin, sutural line indistinct; diameter 33^m - 39^m. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 33^m - 39,um. Observação Esta espécie difere de R. baculiferus Ybert 1975 pela ausência de cones ou báculas. Afinidade Botânica PTERIDOPHYTA. 1941: Azonotríletes nigrítellus Luber in Luber & Wattz 1965: Calamospora nigrítella (Luber & Waltz) Hart Diagnosis Spores radial, trilete. Amb circular orsubcircular. Laesurae simple, straight: length 1/2 - 3/4 of spore radius, often variable on same specimen, Contact areas delimited by curvaturae, distinct to perceptible. Exine O.õ^m - 1^m thick; laevígate or scabrate. A darkened triangular thickening usually deveioped about proximal pole Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 15Mm (27) 40^m. Observação A espécie foi incluída no gênero Retusotriletes por apresentar área de contato e linhas de curvatura visíveis. Holótipo Locus typicus: Atol Blair e carvão Baralaba, Austrália. Scheuringipollenites maximus (Hart) Tiwari 1973 1960 Vesicaspora maxima Hart Diagnosis Miospores usually circular to subcircular. rarely suboval in outline. Central body thin, mostly indistinct, rarely with partly visible outline, apparenttly broadly oval. Sacei hemispherical or less than that, proximally encroaching the central body and apparently merging without any break or line, distally coming close to one another in the median region. Sulcus not defined. but usually the sacei lobes appearing to separate laterally. especially when folded, to give a characteristic appearance. Intrareticulation of fine to médium meshes, muri ± 1pm thick. Dimensões Diâmetro equatorial: 75^m - 150^m. Observação A inclusão da espécie Vesicaspora maxima em Scheuringipollenites é adotada porque em Vesicaspora tanto o corpo central como o sulco são bem marcados, e a construção dos sacos parece monossacóide. Holótipo Locus typicus: Vale do rio Mchuchuma, carvão 8 pés acima do C.S. 12 de Mc Kinlay, Tanzânia, Leste da África. Stratum typicum: Artinskiano, Permiano Inferior. Scheuringipollenites medius (Burjack) Dias-Fabrício 1981 1978: Sulcatisporítes medius Burjack Diagnosis Pollen disaccate, haploxylonoid. Amb subcircuiar to oval with slight transversal elongation. Central body ili-defined. Exine thin. Cappula narrow, ill-defined, folded and diverging at lateral extremities. Saccus narrow, semicircular or less than semi-circle in shape. inframicroreticulated. Dimensões Eixo transversal: 50^m - ôO^m. Eixo longitudinal: 43^01 - Observação Sulcatisporítes medius difere de S. minimus pelo maior tamanho e tendência de maior alongamento no sentido do eixo transversal. Amb oval, with transversal elongation. Corpus ill-defined. Cappula narrow with parallel margins diverging at lateral extremities. Saccus narrow, commonly less than semicircle; in shape, infra reticulated. Dimensões Eixo transversal: 33um - 48^m. Eixo longitudinal: 35íziti - 48irm. Scheuringipollenites ovatus (Balme & Hennelly) Foster 1975 1955: Florinítes ovatus Balme & Hennelly 1960: Vesicaspora ovata (Balme & Hennelly) Hart 1962: Sulcatisporites ovatus ( Balme & Hennelly) Bharadwaj Diagnosis Disaccate, haploxylonoid, amb oval. Corpus longitudinally elongate oval, rarely aimost circular, outline poorly defined. Cappa thin, finely intrareticulate. Sacei semielliptical in polar view, saccus exoexine about 1^m thick, finely and regulariy intrareticulate, brochi 1pm or less in diameter. Cappula narrow, parallel-sided and extending the full lenght of the corpus, often manifested as only a longitudinal line between the distai sacei bases. Dimensões Diâmetro total: 46;zm - 74^171. Diâmetro do corpo: 28^01 - 48;zm. Observação Alisporites splendens (Leschik) Foster 1979 podería ser sinônimo, segundo o autor, de Scheuringipollenites ovatus.
